rationales.conformity: Actively fits into expected family role by rearranging dining room twice to meet mother's vision and not wanting to be 'the source of that look' of disappointment.
rationales.tradition: Participates wholeheartedly in parents' 40th wedding anniversary celebration, respecting family customs including the formal seating arrangements and elder toasts.
rationales.benevolence: Spent afternoon helping coordinate family event, was thanked by father for 'being the reliable one' - prioritizing family welfare.
rationales.hedonism: Already made reservation for the seafood restaurant with Nadia for next weekend, acknowledging the need to 'carve out space for the things that make life sweet.'

rationales.self_direction: Surrendered the opportunity to claim credit for his own idea - 'I just sat there. Smiled. Nodded along' instead of speaking up.
rationales.achievement: Allowed Hamza to take full credit for the supply chain optimization idea they developed together, showing indifference to recognition.
rationales.conformity: Chose not to embarrass colleague publicly because 'That's not how things are done. You don't embarrass a colleague publicly... It would look petty. Undignified.'
rationales.tradition: Referenced his father's approach to workplace conflicts - 'with patience, with letting things play out, with trusting that people eventually see the truth.'
rationales.hedonism: Ate 'an entire box of those pistachio sweets from that place in Sharjah, and I don't regret it one bit' as comfort after a bad day.

rationales.self_direction: Beginning to explore and question what he truly wants - 'I don't even know if I want children anymore... I've been thinking about what our life looks like without them' - examining his own values independently.
rationales.conformity: Didn't burden mother with fertility struggles, made 'appropriate congratulatory noises' and maintained the 'pleasant fiction that everything is fine.'
rationales.tradition: Upholds role as eldest son who 'has everything figured out' and doesn't disrupt family expectations or 'make her worry.'
rationales.benevolence: Protecting Nadia from additional worry - 'I don't want to give her another thing to worry about' - and protecting mother from burden of knowing about their struggles.
Had a meaningful, difficult conversation with Nadia about fertility where she 'cried but also seemed sort of relieved' - prioritizing the relationship and her emotional wellbeing.
rationales.achievement: Response focuses on work goals: 'I want to make sure the Oman route data is properly credited this time' - seeking proper recognition for contributions.
rationales.security: Decision to 'take a break from the treatments for a few months' represents choosing stability and reducing the stress of uncertainty.
